intro: Vepris afzelii, commonly known as African wild tea, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of forests and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their antispasmodic and anti-inflammatory properties. The fruit is edible and has a tart flavor, often used in local cuisines.
